content.text: Snowy suburbs of Toronto. From a nondescript house we hear:

dialogue: Scott Pilgrim is dating a high schooler?

content.text: Four twenty-somethings lounge around a small kitchen table. STEPHEN STILLS, 25, shaggy hair, Canadian Cowboy chic.
KIM PINE, 22, cute, bitter, sweatshirt with a zipper.

dialogue: How old are you now, Scott? Like twenty-eight?
I’m not playing your little games.
So you’ve been out of high school for like, 13 years and-
And you’re dating a high school girl? Not bad, not bad.

content.text: YOUNG NEIL, 20, simple mind, layered T-shirts.

dialogue: Like, did you guys ’do it’ yet?

content.text: SCOTT PILGRIM, 22, fresh faced and charmingly cocky with an unruly yet adorable mop of hair.

dialogue: We have done many things. We ride the bus. We have meaningful conversations about how yearbook club went and about her friends and, um...you know...drama.
Yeah, okay, have you even kissed her?
We almost held hands once, but then she got embarrassed.
Well. Aren’t you pleased as punch?

content.text: Young Neil pauses his Nintendo DS.

dialogue: I believe I mentioned the bus?

content.text: Scott Pilgrim prepares to tell an amazing story:
KNIVES CHAU, 17, cute and innocent with clothes to match, sits next to her mother, MOTHER CHAU, 45, demanding.

dialogue: You are seventeen year old! Time to get interested in boy!

content.text: Knives DROPS her bag, books scattering everywhere.
Knives crouches down to pick up her books, grumbling.
Knives looks up to see the cute and gallant SCOTT PILGRIM holding her books. TEXT appears in an on-screen box:
"SCOTT PILGRIM, 22 YEARS OLD, RATING: AWESOME."
Stars appear in Knives’s eyes. Scott grins heroically. Scott winks at Knives. Scott winks at the camera.
Back in the kitchen, everyone looks at Scott...

dialogue: Is that seriously the end of the story?

content.text: Young Neil unpauses his Nintendo DS.

dialogue: So when do we get to meet her?
Oh please. Let it be soon.

content.text: DINGY DONG! The doorbell rings. Scott smiles broadly.
An eager Knives stands outside. Scott opens the door a crack.
Stephen Stills comes to the door and peers through.

dialogue: Oh, hey. Knives, this is Stephen Stills. He’s the talent.

content.text: STILLS shuts the door on a confused Knives.

dialogue: Is she gonna geek out on us?
She’ll just sit in the corner, man.
I mean, I want her to geek out on us.
She’ll geek. She geeks. She has the capacity to geek.

content.text: Stephen Stills quickly opens the door and waves Knives in.
Knives enters, looking around the rehearsal pad with awe: Bare bulb, ratty rug, drums, guitar, bass, LAME BRAND amps.

dialogue: Knives, that’s Kim. Lemme get your coat.

content.text: Scott throws Knives’ coat on the floor. Knives waves.

dialogue: Hi, sorry, what was your name?

content.text: REVEAL Kim sitting behind the drumset, sticks in her hands.

dialogue: Uh, wow...Zelda...Tetris...that’s kind of a big question.

content.text: Knives stares blankly at Young Neil, who finally gets it.

dialogue: Oh. I’m not in the band. I just live here.

content.text: Sex Bob-Omb has geared up. Amps hum to life.

dialogue: That’s not the actual title of the-

content.text: Kim BASHES the kit and Sex Bob-Omb EXPLODE INTO ROCK!
GUITAR AND BASS LEADS LEAP INTO THE AIR, SPELLING OUT OUR TITLE...
SCOTT PILGRIM VS. THE WORLD
TITLES continue over the song as the small rehearsal space seems to GROW with the music. Stephen Stills barks unintelligible lyrics.
Knives watches, jaw ajar. The song ends, feedback lingering.
Scott bids adieu to a stunned Knives as she gets on a bus.
The band and Young Neil lounge around Stephen Stills’ room.

dialogue: Scott, if your life had a face I would punch it.
I mean, are you really happy or are you really evil?
Like, do I have ulterior motives or something? I’m offended, Kim.

content.text: Scott takes a breath, turns to Young Neil.

dialogue: Neil, you were saying she seems awesome.

content.text: Scott hangs his coat up in a tiny, one room apartment. He turns to WALLACE WELLS, dark hair, arched eyebrow, disloyal.
"WALLACE WELLS, ROOMMATE, 24 YEARS OLD, FUN FACT: HE IS GAY!"

dialogue: Before you hear some dirty lies from someone else, yes, I’m dating a 17 year old.

content.text: Wallace looks up from the NOW magazine he’s reading.

dialogue: Does this mean we have to stop sleeping together?
Do you see another bed in here?

content.text: TINY BOXES OF TEXT indicate the ownership of the items in the one room flat: 95% belongs to Wallace, FUTON included.

dialogue: Yeah. You’re totally my bitch forever.
So. The whole seventeen year old thing. Don’t tell too many people.
I mean. Don’t tell my sister.

content.text: Wallace tosses the NOW magazine aside, starts texting.
RINGY RING. The phone goes. Scott picks up.
Intercut with STACEY PILGRIM, cute, peppy barista, gabbing on her cellphone in THE SECOND CUP. A sign behind her reads ’If you are using your cellphone, you will not be served’.
"STACEY PILGRIM, YOUNGER SISTER, 19, RATING: ’T’ FOR TEEN."

dialogue: That’s not true. Who told you?

content.text: Scott turns to see Wallace on a second cordless.
Wallace clicks off. Scott sinks into an armchair.

dialogue: Who is this mysterious child you date?
Her name is Knives. Knives Chau.
A seventeen year old Chinese schoolgirl? You’re ridiculous.
No no no. We haven’t even held hands. I think she hugged me once.
Um, Scott. Why are you doing this?
I don’t know...it’s just nice, you know? It’s just...simple.
It’s been over a year since you got dumped by she-who-will-not-be-named.

content.text: Scott glances down at the partially obscured NOW magazine, looking into the HOT GIRL’S EYES on the back cover album ad.

dialogue: So, are you legitimately moving on, or is this just you being insane?

content.text: Scott looks at a strip of photobooth pictures: he smiles next to a hot redhead in happier times.

dialogue: Can I get back to you on that?

content.text: A SCHOOL BELL clangs loudly...
Wallace and Scott stand outside a CATHOLIC HIGH SCHOOL. Uniformed boys and girls pour out.

dialogue: I do not want to be here. At all.
I hate you. Even I would think twice about dating a seventeen year old.
Well, she’s only allowed out when the sun is up, so I wouldn’t call it dating, more like...
That doesn’t sound so good either.

content.text: Knives skips to Scott. Her shy friend TAMARA lingers behind.

dialogue: Hey Knives, this is my cool gay roommate, Wallace Wells. He’s gay.
Oh, hi! Do you want to know who in my class is gay?

content.text: Wallace pulls Knives close. Whispers.

dialogue: You’re too good for him. Run.

content.text: Scott and Knives play NINJA NINJA REVOLUTION (think a martial arts version of DANCE DANCE REVOLUTION).
They punch and kick in unison, side by side.

dialogue: Did you know the original name of Pac-man was Puck-man? You would think it’s because Pac-Man looks like a yellow hockey puck, but actually it comes from the Japanese phrase paku-paku which means to flap ones mouth open and closed. They changed it over here because Puck-Man is too easy to vandalize. You know, scratch out the P and turn it into an F or whatever?

content.text: Knives flips over Scott’s back in a COMBO move.
The game ends. CONTINUE appears, counting down: 10...9...8... Scott looks at Knives. She digs for quarters.
Scott and Knives leave a pizza joint, slices in hand.

dialogue: Tamara is into this Korean guy, Bobby, but everyone thinks Bobby has a crush on Mina.
I thought Derek and Tamara had a mutual like-each-other thing going, what happened?

content.text: Scott and Knives shop for T-shirts. Hangers click in time.

dialogue: I don’t listen to much music. I know a lot of kids who play piano or whatever, but you guys ROCK.
I knew I personally rocked, but I never suspected that we rocked as a unit. Thank you, Knives.

content.text: Scott and Knives flip through records in perfect sync.

dialogue: I mean, you guys are gonna be HUGE.
Well, we’re already pretty big. But it might be cool if cool people wore our T-shirt.

content.text: Knives speaks to a female clerk, surly with tats and specs:
"JULIE, 22, STILLS’ GIRLFRIEND, RATING: WHAT IS HER PROBLEM?"

dialogue: Excuse me, do you have anything by ’The Clash At Demonhead’?
Have you tried the section marked ’The Clash At Demonhead’?
Are you coming to my party Friday or will you be busy babysitting?
You don’t want to listen to her. And you definitely don’t want to listen to them.

content.text: Scott puts The Clash at Demonhead CD back in the rack.

dialogue: Oh, I heart them so much.
I hearted them too until they signed to a major label and the
singer turned into a total bitch and ruined my life. But that’s just me.
Envy Adams is sooo cool. Do you read her blog?
Sorry, you were saying about me?

content.text: Scott and Knives amble down a snow covered sidewalk.

dialogue: I mean, I’ve...I’ve never gone out with someone so talented.
You go out with a lot of guys?
I’ve never even kissed a guy.

content.text: Knives blushes and looks at the ground. Scott hugs her.
Scott and Knives walk up to the front of Wallace’s apartment.

dialogue: So this is your secret lair? Can I come in?
My secret lair is one of those ’no girls allowed’ deals.
But do you want to see the house where I grew up?

content.text: They literally walk across the street to a small house.
Wind blows. The light snowfall turns into sand...
...Scott wanders alone through a barren land. He falls to his knees next to a lonely cactus.
A MYSTERIOUS GIRL rollerblades across the shifting sands. She wears fishnets, an army jacket, skirt and goggles. Her pink hair is funky but cool. She is hotter than the desert sun.

dialogue: You’re not alone. You’re just having some idiotic dream.
Does that mean we can make out? But she’s gone...

content.text: ...SCOTT WAKES UP, sitting up in the FUTON.
Wallace wakes up to the left of Scott, rubbing his eyes.

dialogue: I had this totally weird dream.

content.text: A scruffy, goateed guy wakes right between Scott and Wallace:
"OTHER SCOTT, 22, WALLACE’S BOYFRIEND? FUN FACT: GUY CURIOUS"

dialogue: Can we skip the dreamtime? Color me not interested.
Was this an Envy related dream?
We don’t use the E-word in this house.
No, it wasn’t her. It was somebody new...

content.text: Other Scott goes back to sleep. Wallace rubs his eyes.

dialogue: Speaking of new, weren’t you supposed to take your fake high school girlfriend to the library a half-hour ago?
What? It’s like, six in the morning.

content.text: Scott opens the bathroom door. Sunlight ignites the room.
Scott is noticeably taller than all the teens in the library. He carries a stack of books for Knives.

dialogue: Libraries remind me of grade school.
That must seem like a reeeeally long time ago.
Uh. Let’s talk about something else.

content.text: The hiss of ball bearings catches Scott’s attention. He freezes as he sees THE ROLLERBLADING GIRL FROM HIS DREAM skating towards the desk in SEXALICIOUS SLOW MOTION.
The Rollerblading Girl delivers a package from AMAZON.CA to the librarian. Scott’s gaze follows the GIRL as she blades out of the library. Pensive guitar underscores his thoughts.
Scott continues to stare at the girl. Time slows to a crawl.
Scott stands in the rehearsal room, head still in the clouds.

dialogue: You only played one note for that entire song.

content.text: A meek Knives sits next to Young Neil on the couch.

dialogue: I told you like fifty times!

content.text: Scott, Kim Pine, Stephen Stills and Young Neil walk down an icy Toronto street. Scott’s head is still in the clouds.

dialogue: We’re going to this party, retard.
Ugh. I thought you guys split.
We did. But, you know, there may be some label guys there, so...
Aw, man. This is going to suck.
At least it will give us something to complain about.

content.text: A bored Scott stands next to Young Neil in a very crowded house party. Both have red plastic cups in hand.

dialogue: I’m going to go pee due to boredom.

content.text: Scott exits frame.
Neil sips his drink.
Scott passes by COMEAU, a bespectacled hipster geek:
’COMEAU, 25, FUN FACT: KNOWS EVERYONE (INCLUDING YOU)’

dialogue: Hey Scott. Some party huh? You gettin’ your drink on?
This is Coke Zero. I don’t drink.
You don’t drink? I remember you getting ridiculously drunk off two G&T’s one time and-
Do you know this one girl with hair like this?

content.text: Scott sketches an incomprehensible drawing of Ramona.

dialogue: Yeah man. Ramona Flowers. Someone said she was coming tonight actually.
You got the hots for her? I hear she’s hardcore...

content.text: Scott has already left a Scott-shaped dust cloud...
Scott scans the party. His eyes go WIDE. He CRUSHES his plastic cup. There she is...playing the wall...RAMONA! Aloof. Enigmatic. Hot. Scott sidles up and stands next to her.
Scott begins to babble.

dialogue: Well you know Pac-Man was originally Puckman but not because Pac-Man looks like a hockey puck and paku-paku-paku means flapping your mouth and they changed it because if you scratch out the "P" and turn it into an "F"? You know? Like...

content.text: Ramona looks at Scott blankly. He slowly skulks away.

dialogue: I’ll leave you alone forever now.

content.text: "THEN HE STALKED HER FOR THE REST OF THE PARTY..."
Series of quick shots as Scott follows Ramona. He ducks around corners, spies from behind a much bigger dude. Ramona leaves the party. Scott grabs a startled Young Neil.
JUMP CUT. Scott RUNS towards Comeau.

dialogue: DUDE. What do you know about Ramona Flowers?!
All I know is she’s American.
But you should talk to Sandra and Monique-

content.text: "SANDRA AND MONIQUE, 24, TWO GIRLS COMEAU KNOWS"

dialogue: LADYDUDES! What do you know about Ramona Flowers?
I think she has a boyfriend.
Some guy back in New York.
Doesn’t she have the most ridiculous name?
I know. It’s so ’Ramona Quimby, Aged 8’ and yet...Flowers.

content.text: The girls laugh. Scott does not.
JUMP CUT through a FLURRY OF FACES as Scott asks everyone about Ramona:

dialogue: I heard she kicks all kind of ass.
She’s got men dying at her feet.
Not to be entered into lightly.

content.text: We end on the surly JULIE (the rude clerk) who steps in front of Scott, arms crossed. Stephen Stills is with her.

dialogue: You know her? Tell me. Now.
She just moved here. Got a job with Amazon. Comes into my work.
Didn’t you say she just broke up with someone, Jools?
That they had a huge fight or whatever?
...yes. But I didn’t want Scott to know that, Stephen.
Yeah, I don’t know what it is about that girl, she just-
Scott, I forbid you from hitting on Ramona. Even if you haven’t had a real girlfriend in over a year-
Hey whoa, whoa. Scott’s mourning period is officially over. He’s totally dating a high schooler.
Dating a high schooler is the mourning period.
I thought you guys broke up.
I don’t want you scaring off the coolest girl at my party Scott. We all know you’re a total lady killer wannabe jerky jerk.
That time you dumped Kim for-
Hey, me and Kim are all good now.

content.text: SCOTT looks to KIM. We hear the sound of arctic winds.

dialogue: Whatever, Ramona is out of your league, let’s leave it at that. And anyway, I’m not even sure she really did have a big breakup. She keeps mentioning some guy named Gideon.
Yeah, I don’t know what it is about that girl, she just-

content.text: Scott lies on the futon, WIDE awake. Wallace storms in.
Wallace flops onto the futon, landing next to Scott.

dialogue: So, that girl. From my dream.
I saw her at the library...
Library...can I pretend we’re talking about a guy?
So then I’m at this party, and hey! There she is.
I think she’s the girl of my dreams.
Mmm. Then you should break up with your fake high school girlfriend.
I’ve never been so sure about something.
Then you should break up with your fake high school girlfriend.

content.text: Wallace drifts off. RINGY RING! Scott answers. INTERCUT with STACEY sitting on a bus on her cellphone.

dialogue: You’re thinking of juggling two chicks!?
Well, you should break up with your fake high school girlfriend.
Whatever. You of all people should know how sucky it is to get cheated on.
Don’t you have a job to do?
You’re right. I should send out a mass text about this. Bye.

content.text: Scott looks to Wallace, who is out cold, cellphone in hand.

dialogue: Wallace, how do you do that?

content.text: HARD CUT to MORNING LIGHT filling the room!
Wallace sits bolt upright. Scott sits at Wallace’s computer.

dialogue: Amazon.ca. What’s the website for that?
Awesome! I have to order something reeeally cool.
Dude! This thing claims I have mail!
It’s amazing what they can do with computers these days.
"Dear Mr. Pilgrim, It has come to my attention that we will be fighting soon. My name is Matthew Patel, and I’m" blah blah "fair warning" blah blah...hmm. This is...this is...THIS IS...!!!

content.text: ’CLICK.’ Scott walks to the front door. Moments pass.

dialogue: Scott. Are you waiting for the package you just ordered?
It’s the weekend. It won’t ship until Monday at the earliest.

content.text: DINGY DONG. Scott JUMPS to his feet.
Scott opens the door. It’s KNIVES CHAU!
Knives smothers Scott.
He plasters on his best fake smile.

dialogue: Remember you were supposed to meet me at the bus stop a half-hour ago?

content.text: Scott and Knives flip through the record bins, out of sync.

dialogue: Yearbook club is getting SO boring. I cannot believe the music they put on while we work.

content.text: Knives buys a hip and trendy jacket. Scott sits on a couch next to the DO NOT SIT sign, still distracted.

dialogue: Hannah broke up with Alan and now she’s all into Derek...

content.text: Scott and Knives walk out of a pizza joint. Knives chows down on a slice. Scott doesn’t eat, his thoughts elsewhere.

dialogue: ...but Tamara claims she has dibs on Derek.

content.text: Scott and Knives play NINJA NINJA REVOLUTION, side by side. Scott plays halfheartedly, his timing off.
Knives goes to flip over Scott, but he messes up. THE MIRROR IMAGE of Scott’s videogame avatar appears on screen.
NEGANINJA - squares up against Scott’s avatar.

dialogue: I can never get past that guy.

content.text: Scott has his little videogame head cut off. The "CONTINUE?" countdown comes up...10...9...8...

dialogue: Do you want to keep going?

content.text: Scott takes a long look at Knives.
Scott takes a deep breath. This is never easy. 3...2...1...
An excited Stills addresses Sex Bob-Omb. Scott tunes his bass, alone by the window, staring out.
Knives BURSTS into frame. Scott winces.

dialogue: Wednesday, The Rockit. And even better? It’s the T.I.B.B.
The Toronto International Battle of The Bands?!
S’right. This guy at work was like "Steve, do you know anyone in a band?" and I was like ’I’m in a band.’ and he was like ’You’re in a band?’ and I was like ’Yeah I’m totally in a band’ -
Is there a prize or something?!
Only a record deal with G-man Graves!

content.text: Stills gestures to Knives’ home-made Sex Bob-Omb T-shirt.

dialogue: If we win...it won’t just be Knives wearing a Sex Bob-Omb shirt. It’ll be the cool kids too.

content.text: Knives can barely contain herself. She grabs Scott.

dialogue: I will do everything I can to get out of study group and come.

content.text: We follow Scott as he walks in a daze to the bathroom.

dialogue: Oh my gosh, who are you battling?
That one band with Crash? And those Boys?
Oh my gosh, I hate them too!

content.text: Scott pees in a state of dreamy reverie. The PEE BAR above his head slowly reduces. He stares at himself in the mirror. Scott exits the bathroom, entering...

...a long, empty HIGH SCHOOL HALLWAY. Scott’s footsteps echo as he moves towards a classroom door with a STAR on it... RAMONA FLOWERS bursts through the door, skating past Scott and down the hall, PACKAGE from AMAZON clutched in her hand. Scott runs after her, around a corner, down a row of LOCKERS leading to...the outside of WALLACE’S APARTMENT???
Scott LEAPS out of the futon and RUNS towards the front door, THROWING IT OPEN and startling Ramona Flowers just as she presses the doorbell. DINGY DONG...

dialogue: Hi, um, I was thinking about asking you out, but then I realized how stupid that would be.
So do you wanna go out sometime?
Um, no, that’s okay. You just have to sign for this alright?
I just woke up, and you were in my dream. I dreamt you were delivering me this package. Is that weird?
No, it’s just like, you’ve got this really convenient subspace highway running through your head that I like to use. It’s like three miles in fifteen seconds.
Oh yeah. I forgot you guys don’t have that in Canada.
You don’t remember me do you? I met you at the party the other day.
No. Not even. That was some total ass. I was the other guy. You’re Ramona Flowers right?
Why, am I coming off as rude?

content.text: Scott stands in awe of Ramona. She gives him a pen.

dialogue: You know...you need to sign for this. Whatever this is?
It’s something really cool. You’d be impressed.
But if I sign for it, you’ll leave.
Okay well, can we just maybe just hang out sometime? Get to know each other? You’re the new kid on the block, right? I’ve lived here forever. I mean...there are reasons for you to hang out with me?
I need to find a new route.
Either that or you need to start hanging out with me.
You want me to hang out with you?
If I say yes, will you sign for your damn package?

content.text: Scott finally signs on the dotted line. And throws the package straight in the trash.
Scott finds Ramona waiting at the top of some stairs in the park. The Toronto skyline gleams in the night behind them.

dialogue: Why are you just standing there?
Dude, I’m totally waiting on you.
Sorry, I just assumed you were too cool to be on time.
So what do you want to do? We could get a slice at Pizza Pizza or flip through some records at Sonic Boom. Oh, or there’s this awesome game called Ninja Ninja Revolution at-
I’m cool with whatever you want to do.

content.text: Scott and Ramona trudge through the snow in the empty park.

dialogue: This is good. So how’d you end up in Toronto?
Just needed to escape I guess.
I got this job here. And Gideon had always said Toronto was one of the great cities so...
Do you mind if we don’t get into that right now?
It’s so not interesting to me.

content.text: They sit on some swings in the park.

dialogue: So what about you? What do you do?
My last job is a long story filled with sighs.
Is that why you left New York?
Pretty much. It was time to head somewhere a little more chilled.
I didn’t mean to get you obsessed.
I just haven’t been obsessed with a girl for a long time. It’s weird.
That’s probably because you sleep with a guy.
I was guessing from your apartment, but you totally do!
It’s... we’re just poor! We can’t afford two beds! We’re not gay! Actually... no... Wallace is pretty gay.
Dude, relax. I believe you. You’re too desperate to be gay.
Aw... you’re probably not that stupid.

content.text: Laughing, Ramona hops off her swing.

dialogue: Well, you’re definitely stupid if you want to go out with me.

content.text: The snowfall gets heavier.

dialogue: This is ridiculous. Isn’t it like April?
Yeah. I can barely see you. This whole thing is an unmitigated disaster.
I think ’act of God’ is a pretty decent excuse for a lousy date.
Did I say ’date’? Slip of the tongue.

content.text: The snow gets heavier still. Ramona walks away.

dialogue: Anyway, night’s not over yet. I think there’s a thingy up here somewhere.
A door? I... I... I can’t see you. I’m blind. Help me.

content.text: A door with a STAR on it appears out of the whiteness. Ramona opens the door. Scott and Ramona fall into blackness...
Scott shivers at the kitchen table of Ramona’s cozy, girl friendly apartment. He watches as she slips out of her coat.

dialogue: What kind of tea do you want?

We have blueberry, raspberry, ginseng, sleepytime, green tea, green tea with lemon, green tea with lemon and honey, liver disaster, ginger with honey, ginger without honey, vanilla almond, white truffle, blueberry chamomile, vanilla walnut, constant comment and earl grey.
Did you make some of those up?
Let me get you a blanket.

content.text: Ramona exits. After a moment alone, Scott ventures upstairs. He wanders towards a half open door. Pushing it open, he finds Ramona in her bedroom in her bra and skirt.
Scott covers his eyes and our screen goes BLACK.
Scott opens his eyes to see Ramona hugging him.

They look into each others eyes...camera circles Scott and Ramona as they begin an awesome make out session. Scott imagines himself soundtracking the kiss with a slinky bassline. Ramona breaks off, smiling. Scott is in heaven.

dialogue: Were you..were you just going to bring the blanket from your bed?
Maybe...maybe we should both get under it...since we’re so cold.

content.text: The slinky bassline continues as Ramona takes her skirt off, revealing black panties to complement black bra. Scott takes his shirt off. They tumble onto the bed and make out. Then-

dialogue: Changed it to what? From what?
I don’t want to have sex with you, Pilgrim. Not right now.
It’s not like I’m gonna send you home in a snowstorm or anything. You can sleep in my bed. And I reserve the right to change my mind about the sex later.

content.text: Ramona curls up next to Scott.

dialogue: This is cool, just this. It’s been like a really long time, and this is...I think I needed this. Whatever this is. So, thanks.

content.text: They exchange a smile. Then without warning we jump cut to -
DAYLIGHT! Scott awakens. Ramona is gone. An arrow points to the empty spot in the bed next to him.
’RAMONA’ Another arrow point out that-
’SHE’S IN THE SHOWER’ Ramona steps out of the bathroom in a towel. Scott relaxes.
Ramona skates towards the front gate, Scott walking next to her. WAIST DEEP SNOW covers the roads and sidewalks.

dialogue: Hey, can this not be a one night stand? For one thing, I didn’t even get any...that was a joke.
What did you have in mind?
Umm...oh, come to the first round of this battle of the bands thing.

content.text: Ramona shrugs and ROLLERBLADES through the snow...(somehow)

dialogue: Wait! Can I get your number?

content.text: SSSSHHHOOP! Ramona skids to a stop, right back next to Scott. She hands him a note. ’RAMONA FLOWERS, 212 664-7665, xxxxxxx’
Scott looks back up. Ramona is already skating far, far away.

dialogue: See you at the show, Scott Pilgrim.

content.text: ’THE ROCKIT, FUN FACT: THIS PLACE IS A TOILET’
Ramona wades through a grungy venue under the stare of young hipsters, reaching Scott at the bar. He stands with Wallace and Stacey. She holds hands with a guy wearing glasses.
Scott is so amazed at her presence, his social skills vanish.

dialogue: Excuse my brother. He’s chronically enfeebled. I’m Stacey.
And this is Wallace, his room-mate.
And this is my boyfriend Jimmy.

content.text: Scott goes white. He didn’t even see Knives come in.
Knives pecks Scott on the cheek. He pushes her away. Knives looks kinda sexy, wearing makeup and new clothes.
LEONE STAREDOWNS all around. Stacey stares at Scott. Knives and Ramona stare at each other. Wallace stares at Jimmy.
Scott scurries off. We hear feedback from a mic onstage.

dialogue: This next band are from Brampton and they are Crash And The Boys.

content.text: Scott runs backstage to see Stills obsessively flipping through a chart with hand drawn stats of their rival band.

dialogue: This is a nightmare. Is this a nightmare? Wake up, wake up, wake up.
Once we’re on stage you’ll be fine.
We were just on stage. For sound check. The sound guy hated us.
It’s just nerves! Pre-show jitters. People love us. Right?

content.text: Scott sounds less than convincing. He looks up at Ramona and Knives sitting with Wallace, Jimmy and Stacey in the BALCONY.
Crash and The Boys tune up. A drunk Wallace turns to Jimmy.

dialogue: Jimmy. Do they rock or suck?
That was a test, Jimmy. You passed.
Good evening. I am Crash, and these are the Boys.
IS THAT GIRL A BOY, TOO?

content.text: Sex Bob-omb peer at the band from offstage. Kim glowers.

dialogue: This is called "I am so sad. I am so very very sad." And it goes a little something like this.

content.text: Crash and the Boys play a whole song in .04 seconds.
Wallace yells from the balcony.

dialogue: This song is for the guy who keeps yelling from the balcony, and it’s called "We Hate You, Please Die."

content.text: Crash continues his rampage of musical hate.

dialogue: These guys are good. Are these guys good?

content.text: Kim Pine scowls harder than ever.

dialogue: This is called "Last Song Kills Audience". It’ll be our last song tonight and your last song EVER...

content.text: Sound explodes from the stage. The audience are stunned.
Stills paces backstage as the others watch the band.

dialogue: How are we supposed to follow this? We’re not going to win, we’re not gonna sign with G-Man and we’ll never play opening night at the Chaos Theatre.
GODDAMN IT SCOTT, WILL YOU STOP JUST STANDING THERE, YOU’RE FREAKING ME OUT!

content.text: As Crash And The Boys climax, Stacey turns to Ramona.

dialogue: So, how do you know Scott?
Hard for me to keep track sometimes. He has so many friends.

content.text: Ramona arches an eyebrow. Stacey turns to Knives and Tamara.

dialogue: So Knives, how did you meet Scott?

content.text: Scott looks up into the balcony, sees Stacey talking to Knives. He turns around and slaps Stephen Stills in the face.

dialogue: We gotta play now and loud!

content.text: Stacey and Ramona listen intently to Knives’ story.

dialogue: Well, I was on the bus with my Mom-

content.text: Knives freezes, staring at the stage.

dialogue: Is that seriously the end of the story?

content.text: ONSTAGE: A DISHEVELED PROMOTER walks to the mic.

dialogue: This next band is from Toronto and...yeah. So give it up for Sex...Bob-Omb?

content.text: SEX BOB-OMB walk on. Wallace and Knives give the only cheers.
Scott nods vigorously.

dialogue: WE ARE SEX BOB-OMB. ONE, TWO...

content.text: ANGLE on Knives. She faints in the excitement.

Sex Bob-omb rock out, barely into the first verse when a chunk of ceiling CRASHES down and a SPINDLY INDIAN HIPSTER KID DIVES HEAD FIRST through the hole, finger pointed at Scott as he sails towards the stage!
MATTHEW PATEL lands onstage and glares at Scott through a lopsided fringe. He wears an evil grin and a jacket that borders on flamboyant. He drags on a cigarette (blacked out).

dialogue: Mr. Pilgrim. It is I, Matthew Patel. Consider our fight...begun!

content.text: Matthew Patel leaps in the air and sails toward Scott.
Scott throws his bass to Young Neil and BLOCKS Patel with his left arm, then PUNCHES him across the floor with his right. Patel LANDS like a cat, FLIPS his fringe and GLARES at Scott.

dialogue: Watch out! It’s that one guy!

content.text: Patel RUNS at Scott. Scott SPIN KICKS Patel in the chin and sends him flying into the air. They land in THE PIT, knocking hipsters down and squaring off in the resulting circle.

dialogue: Who the hell are you anyway?

content.text: The LIGHTING GUY spotlights the fighters.

dialogue: My name is Matthew Patel and I’m Ramona’s first evil ex-boyfriend!

content.text: All eyes WHIP up to Ramona...
Patel attacks Scott with spin kicks. Scott blocks. Patel punches. Scott blocks, then holds his hand up for a time-out.

dialogue: Didn’t you get my e-mail explaining the situation?
You will pay for your insolence!

content.text: Patel attacks, landing kicks and punches. Scott evades and counter-attacks. Patel evades, then lands more punches. Scott jump-spins away from danger. They pause, breathing heavy.
Scott looks at Patel’s outfit.
Patel attacks again. They exchange furious blows, until Patel puts Scott in a choke hold. Scott looks up to Ramona.

dialogue: You really went out with this guy?

content.text: The Lighting Guy SWINGS the spotlight to Ramona in the balcony. We see a sketchy childlike ANIMATED FLASHBACK.

dialogue: It was football season and for some reason, all the little jocks wanted me. Matthew was the only non-white, non-jock boy in school, probably in the entire state, so we joined forces and took ’em all out. We were one hell of a team. Nothing could beat Matthew’s mystical powers. Nothing but pre-teen capriciousness. We only kissed once. After a week and a half, I told him to hit the showers.

content.text: The spotlight swings back onto Scott and Patel.
Patel levitates into the air and points at Ramona.
Patel SNAPS his fingers and launches into a BOLLYWOOD SONG!

dialogue: If you want to fight me, you’re not the brightest. You won’t know what’s hit you in the slightest.

content.text: Patel levitates into the air. Four hot girls in skirts with fangs and bat-wings appear in the air around him.

dialogue: Me and my fireballs and my Demon Hipster Chicks, I’m talking the talk because I know I’m slick.

content.text: Patel and the Demon Hipster Chicks shoot FIREBALLS at Scott. He flips back onto the stage, narrowly dodging the attack.

dialogue: Fireball Girls! Take this sucker down.

content.text: The Demon Hipster Chicks unleash more fireballs. Scott dodges. The house drum kit is trashed behind him.

dialogue: Let us show him what we’re all about.

content.text: Scott hits the ground, dodging a third wave of fireballs. They explode Crash and the Boys in the wings.
Scott rolls across the stage, GRABS one of Kim’s CYMBALS and throws it Captain America style. It hits Patel square in the eyes. POOF, the Demon Hipster Chicks vanish.

dialogue: This is impossible, how can it be?!

content.text: Scott leaps into the air. Patel opens his eyes just in time to see Scott Pilgrim’s FIST racing towards his face.

dialogue: Open your eyes. Maybe you’ll see.

content.text: K.O! Scott punches Patel. He explodes into COINS. They clatter to the stage floor. Scott lands and picks them up.
Ramona makes her way out fast. Passes Stacey.

dialogue: Well, it was great meeting you. Tell your gay friends I said bye.

content.text: Stacey turns to see Wallace and Jimmy making out.
Ramona passes Knives, who is being resuscitated by Tamara.
Scott picks up the coins onstage and counts them.
Ramona yanks Scott away. The Promoter ambles back onstage.
Knives is now wide awake, clapping wildly from the balcony. Her eyes scan the venue for Scott...but he is long gone.
A bemused Scott and mortified Ramona sit on the bus home.

dialogue: What was all that all about?

content.text: Ramona takes a breath. Looks deep into Scott’s eyes.

dialogue: If we’re going to date, you may have to defeat my seven evil ex’s.
-defeat your seven evil ex’s if we’re going to continue to date.
Cool. Do you want to make out?

content.text: Scott kisses Ramona. The studio audience ’awwww’s.
A bleary Wallace fries bacon. Scott bursts through the front door, a spring in his step. The studio audience applauds.

dialogue: Well, someone got to second base last night. And someone has a second date tonight.
You know when I say ’˜someone’, I mean me, right? I got to second base last night...maybe first and a half.

content.text: Wallace shoots a look at the idiotically upbeat Scott.

dialogue: Oh, hey, I’m inviting Ramona over for dinner, so you can’t be here tonight. I don’t want you gaying up the place.
Okay, Scott. But in return I have to issue an ultimatum.
It may live in infamy...You have to break up with Knives. Today. Okay?

content.text: Scott huffs and helps himself to some of Wallace’s bacon.

dialogue: If you don’t do it, I’m going to tell Ramona about Knives. I swear to God, Scott.

content.text: At this point a sleepy JIMMY wanders out of the bathroom and helps himself to coffee.
Scott points bacon at Wallace accusingly.

dialogue: I didn’t make up the gay rulebook. If you have a problem with it, take it up with Liberace’s Ghost.
Now put the bacon down and go do your dirt while I watch the Lucas Lee marathon on TBS Superstation.

content.text: Wallace points to a hunky actor on the cover of NOW magazine.

dialogue: He was this pretty good skater and now he’s this pretty good actor. He’s filming a Winifred Hailey movie in Toronto right now.
Yes. I am stalking him later.
Lucas Lee is not important to you right now! Get out.

content.text: Scott grumbles off. Wallace turns the television way up. We see Lucas Lee on a payphone in some crummy thriller.

dialogue: Listen close and listen hard, bucko. The next click is me hanging up. The one after that...is me pulling the trigger.

content.text: A shivering and annoyed Scott dials the payphone.

dialogue: Oh, hey, Knives. Um, do you want to, like, talk or whatever?
Are you wearing a tan jacket? Like a spring jacket? And a hoodie?

content.text: Scott checks what he’s wearing. SPOOKY MUSIC underscores.

dialogue: It’s not dorky! Why are you psychic?

content.text: A beaming Knives knocks on the payphone glass.
The SPOOKY MUSIC continues on in the record store.
Scott is on edge as Knives geeks over a standee for THE CLASH AT DEMONHEAD: it features sultry blonde singer ENVY ADAMS posing and the rest of the band shrouded in shadow and mist.

dialogue: I can’t believe they’re coming to town. Will you take me to the show?

content.text: The SPOOKY MUSIC gets louder, pounding inside Scott’s head.

dialogue: Oh, hey, I wanted to invite you over for dinner.
Yeah. Well, to meet my parents. It’s my birthday dinner.
Uh...I think that’s a really bad idea. Like, really, just so bad.
Well I mean, I’m too old for you!
No you’re not! My Dad is nine years older than my Mom...
And...and...are you even allowed to date outside your race or whatever?

content.text: Knives is so smitten, the word actually appears onscreen. Scott brushes it away. The SPOOKY MUSIC comes to a stop.

dialogue: Um, listen...I was thinking we should break up or whatever.
Yeah...um...it’s not going to work out.

content.text: Scott walks out, leaving Knives in the aisle.

Scott sits on the bus alone, thinking about Knives. CROSSCUT with Knives still in the record store, in shock. ON THE BUS: Scott sighs, thinks of something happier... CROSSCUT with Ramona: rollerblading, her funky pink hair. ON THE BUS: Scott smiles, a little happier.
Sex Bob-Omb tune up. Kim spins a drumstick in her fingers.
Young Neil PAUSES his DS. Kim and Stills share a look.

dialogue: OH! Check it out, I learned the bass line from Final Fantasy 2.

content.text: Scott plays the insanely simple video game tune.

dialogue: Scott, you are the salt of the earth.
Wait. I meant scum of the earth.
Yeah, but don’t worry, maybe you’ll meet my new new girlfriend soon.

content.text: Kim mimes shooting herself. Stills unplugs Scott’s amp.

dialogue: Okay! From here on out, no GIRLFRIENDS or GIRLFRIEND talk at practice, whether they’re old, new or new-new. We were lucky to survive that last round. This is sudden death now. Okay?

content.text: DINGY DONG...
Scott opens the door to see Ramona, now sporting BLUE HAIR.

dialogue: Yes. Like you said. Is it not cool?

content.text: Scott ushers her in, weirded out by this hair development.

dialogue: Yeah. I just dyed it. Are you going to introduce me?
Oh yeah, this is Stephen Stills, Young Neil, that’s... Kim.

content.text: Everyone mumbles back. Scott still stares at Ramona’s hair.

dialogue: Is it weird not being pink anymore?
I change my hair every week and a half, dude. Get used to it.
So...uh...how do you guys all know each other?
Believe it or not, I actually dated Scott in high school.

content.text: Scott fake laughs. Starts ushering Ramona out again.

dialogue: Okay. Cool. See you guys tomorrow.

content.text: Ramona lounges, reading a magazine. A tense Scott hurries around the kitchen area, preparing food as Wallace looks on.
Ramona goes to the bathroom. Scott drops the act.

dialogue: I know, but she changed it without even making a big deal about it. She’s spontaneous. Impulsive. Fickle. Oh my god, what do I do?
I can’t believe you were worried about me gaying up the place.

content.text: Ramona returns. Wallace pulls on a jacket.

dialogue: I’ll leave you lovebirds to it. I’m heading up to Casa Loma to stalk my hetero crush.

content.text: Scott stops Wallace at the door, with a panicked whisper.

dialogue: Will you man the hell up? You could get to 2nd and a half base.
Well, if you strike out in the next hour, come find me at the Castle.

content.text: ’15 MINUTES LATER’ Ramona and Scott eat on the floor, picnic style. Scott has cooked garlic bread (and only garlic bread) for dinner.

dialogue: This is actually really good garlic bread.
Garlic bread is my favorite food. I could honestly eat it for every meal. Or just all the time without even stopping.
No. Why would I get fat?

content.text: bass guitar.

dialogue: So I wrote a song about you.
Yeah, it goes like this: Ra-mona, Ra-mona, Ra-ra-ra, Mona, Ra-mona, Ra-mona, Ra-ra-ra, Mona, Ooooh.
I can’t wait to hear it when it’s finished.

content.text: ’15 MINUTES LATER’ Scott makes out with Ramona on the futon. Scott smiles as she runs her hands through his hair.
OH GOD! I NEED A HAIRCUT DON’T I?!?
Scott sits up like a shot. Ramona is taken aback.

dialogue: Ha. No, sorry. It’s just that I got... I got a bad haircut right before me and my big ex broke up. But it’s so long ago, I can barely remember it...

content.text: A deep voiced NARRATOR chimes in. Earl Jones deep.

dialogue: Scott is acutely aware that his last salon haircut took place
exactly 431 days ago, three hours before his big breakup. He blames this largely on the haircut and has been cutting his own hair ever since.
I mean, she told me it was mutual.
She dumped him. It was brutal.
She was Nat when I knew her. But she stopped liking that name. Then...she stopped liking me...
Your hair is cute. I like it long.
But it’d be cuter short! Wouldn’t it?!

content.text: Scott disappears and just as quickly reappears, now wearing his dorky SNOW HAT, hair tucked tightly beneath the flaps.

dialogue: What? Why are you wearing that?
I thought we could go for a walk.

content.text: ’15 MINUTES LATER’ Scott and Ramona climb a STAIRWAY, long handrail between them.

dialogue: Tell me we didn’t come out here just so you could cover your hair with that hat.
Nooo. I just love me some walking. Putting one leg in front of the other.

Yeah. I don’t know. I just, when I’m with you I feel like I’m on drugs. Not that I do drugs, unless you do, in which case I do drugs all the time, every drug, but...you make me feel...I don’t know. Things seem a little brighter around you or something.

content.text: Ramona and Scott finally reach the top of the stairs and NIGHT TURNS TO DAY, as if crossing a magical line.

dialogue: A totally awesome castle. They’re shooting this movie up here.

content.text: Ramona looks up at the looming CASA LOMA, a castle surrounded by big, bright movie set lights.

dialogue: Winifred Hailey and some actor guy.

content.text: A crew readies a shot of WINIFRED HAILEY held hostage by some GOON. A STAND IN takes the place of the leading man. Scott and Ramona approach some SPECTATORS, including Wallace.

dialogue: Did you find the guy you’re stalking?
I think I’m about to right now.

content.text: The UNIVERSAL STUDIOS FANFARE announces LUCAS LEE as he exits his trailer, smoking a cigarette (blacked out). He skates towards the set, doing kickflips. The spectators go ’oooh’.

dialogue: I want to have his adopted babies.
I used to date that clown.
Wallace. I am not a slut.
I can think of no higher accolade.

content.text: Lucas steps to his mark and puffs up into action hero mode.
Lucas Lee points his board at the GOON.

dialogue: Hey. The only thing keeping me and her apart is the two minutes it’s gonna take to kick your ass.
In 9th grade. We had drama. Actually, it might have been math. I just remember there being lots of drama.

content.text: Lucas Lee points at Scott, who remains oblivious.

dialogue: He just followed me around. He was a little snot nosed brat.
He had snot? In his nose? But he’s famous!
It’s not a big deal. I only dated him for a week and a half-
I’m talking to you Scott Pilgrim!

content.text: Lucas Lee stomps towards Scott, who gasps.

dialogue: He’s famous and he talked to me!
The only thing keeping me and her apart is the two minutes it’s gonna take to kick your ass!

content.text: POW! Lucas Lee punches Scott, flooring him. Scott comes back up with a pen and paper, wobbly.
POW! Lucas Lee PUNCHES Scott again. He nods to Ramona.

dialogue: Sup. How’s life? He seems nice.

content.text: Lucas Lee THROWS Scott up into a castle turret, crumbling it. Scott CRASHES down through scaffolding onto the set. Lucas holds up his hands for a quick continuity photo, then stomps over to pick up a dazed Scott from the ground.

dialogue: Think you stand a chance against an A-lister, bro?

content.text: Lucas Lee PUNCHES Scott again. He slides across the wet-down ground. A SET NURSE sprays Lucas’ knuckles with antiseptic.
Lucas Lee wanders off. Scott staggers to his feet, punchy.

dialogue: Hey... hey... hey! I’m not done-

content.text: Scott spins Lucas around, only to find an identical STAND IN!
Scott turns to see the real Lucas, smirking on the sidelines. POW! The identical Stand In punches Scott to the ground.

dialogue: He’s good, right? Sometimes I let him do wide shots if I feel like getting blazed back in my winnie.

content.text: Scott stands to fight the double. Suddenly, COUNTLESS STUNTMEN fan out behind the STAND IN, all identically dressed, all carrying skateboards and ready to rumble.

dialogue: I’m nothing without my stunt team.

content.text: The Stuntmen ATTACK Scott Pilgrim with a howl. Scott PUNCHES through a couple of the boards, Tae Kwon Doe style.

dialogue: Ask them how it feels to always get his sloppy seconds!

content.text: KROW! Scott takes a skateboard to the face, followed by a barrage of crippling skateboard blows to his knees and ribs.

dialogue: I’m gonna get coffee. You homies want anything?

content.text: We follow the smirking Lucas to the coffee station. We hear the noise of punching and kicking slowly subside to nothing.
Lucas turns, shocked to see Scott, in front of a PAINTED 2-D SKYLINE BACKDROP, surrounded by many unconscious stuntmen.

Scott CHARGES Lucas Lee and leaps into a FLYING KICK. Lucas GRABS his foot and hurls him through the backdrop. RRRIP! Scott lands in a CRUMP, framed through the torn skyline. Lucas stomps over to him, preparing for the deathblow.

dialogue: Prepare... prepare to feel the wrath of the League of Evil Exes!
You really don’t know about the "The League"?
Seven evil exes? Coming to kill you? Controlling the future of Ramona’s love life?
Oh, well then don’t worry about it.
Yeah, bro. Let’s get a beer.

content.text: Lucas offers a hand. Scott goes to shake it. POW! Lucas gets him square in the mouth. Scott smiles through his aching jaw.

dialogue: You are a pretty good actor.
I’m going for the Oscar this year.
But are you a pretty good skater?
I’m more than pretty good, ese. I have my own skate company.

content.text: Lucas pulls down his shirt, revealing a skate company tattoo.

dialogue: So you can sell them, but can you do a thingy on that rail?

content.text: Scott points to the LONG HANDRAIL on the stairs.

dialogue: So can you do a grind thingy now?
Are you serious? There’s like 200 steps and the rails are garbage.
You really think you can goad me into doing a trick like that?

content.text: Wallace taps Lucas’ shoulder and hands him his skateboard.
CLACK! Lucas GOES FOR IT, a perfect ollie onto the rail. Scott and Wallace watch as Lucas disappears from sight, sparking down the ENDLESS RAIL...HSSSSSSSSSSSSSS...
Cut back to Scott & Wallace, impressed at Lucas.
HSSSSSSSSS...
Cut back to Scott & Wallace, very impressed at Lucas.
HSSSSSSSSS...
Cut back to Scott & Wallace. Scott’s about to say ’wow’ when- BOOOOOOOOM! A fireball appears from the bottom of the stairs.
Fist bump. Scott smacks his forehead.

dialogue: Where’s Ramona? Is she still here?

content.text: Scott slumps on the couch, phone pressed to his ear. Wallace cooks bacon in the kitchen (no pants). We hear the OUTGOING MESSAGE: This is an automated voice messaging system. RAMONA is not available, please record your message after the beep.

dialogue: Hey. It’s me, Scott again. Call me back. Scott Pilgrim.

content.text: Scott ambles over to the fridge and rests his head on it.

dialogue: Yeah, you said that last night.
You know what really sucks though?
Come on guy, you can’t say you didn’t see this coming. It was right under your nose.

content.text: Wallace points to the NOTE Ramona scribbled which is pinned literally under Scott’s nose on the refrigerator: RAMONA

dialogue: What did you think these were?

content.text: Wallace cocks an eyebrow. Scott slides to the floor.

dialogue: Why does everything have to be so complicated?

content.text: Wallace crouches down to join Scott on the floor.

dialogue: If you want something bad, you have to fight for it. Step up your game. Break out the L-word.

Okay, it’s ’love’. I wasn’t trying to trick you or anything. Look, if she’s really the girl of your dreams, then you have to let her know. You have to overcome any and all obstacles that lie in your path. You have the spirit of a warrior, Scott. You can do it! Be with her! It’s your destiny!
Plus, I need you to move out.

content.text: Scott’s face falls, completely shocked at this bombshell.

dialogue: What? Why? Are you moving in with Other Scott or Jimmy or someone?
Or someone. Either way, I’m kind of banking on her calling you back so I won’t have to evict you and feel all guilty and shit.

content.text: RINGY RING. Scott and Wallace look at the phone.

dialogue: I have a feeling that’s for you, guy.

content.text: Scott picks up. A SEXY, NON-RAMONA VOICE REPLIES...

dialogue: I’m not doing so good right now.
That’s too bad. Still breaking hearts?
What? No, stop. I’ve been-it’s been different. You have no idea.
Probably not. Do you have a girlfriend? Should I be jealous?
Yes, you should. I have this totally awesome girlfriend who calls me all the time. And she’s America. Uh. She’s American.
I’m not telling you that. Ramona.
I gotta go. Nice chatting with you.

content.text: CLICK...Scott slumps to the floor. Wallace appears over him.
Scott grunts. RINGY RING. Wallace grins and grabs the phone.
Scott sits bolt upright, expectant.
Scott lays back down. FUCK.
Scott sits bolt upright again. FUCK! Wallace opens the door a crack. Knives shivers outside, pale and broken looking.
Behind Wallace, we see Scott LEAP through a window head first. GLASS SMASHES.
Knives sighs. Scott sprints away in the background.
Scott walks fast down the street, freaked out and paranoid. He sees five ’X’s looming above him on a pedestrian crossing and quickly diverts into an...
Scott rips the ’X-Men’ patch off his jacket, when-
WHZZZ - SOMETHING buzzes past Scott. He looks around.
WHOOSH - another blast of air whizzes by.
SHFFF - SOMETHING sweeps him off his feet. He’s pissed now.

dialogue: I’m really not in the mood.

content.text: SHWAA - SOMETHING slices the air in front of Scott.
Scott punches the air in front of him. Hits SOMETHING. A DIMINUTIVE DIRTY BLONDE dressed in a punk rock kung fu get up lands on the ground with a thump. She spins to face Scott.

dialogue: You punched me in the boob. Prepare to die, obviously.
Listen, I’ve had it today. Can we not do this right now?
Love to postpone, darlin’, but I just cashed my last raincheck.
Well whatever this is about, can it wait till I’m in the right frame of mind?

content.text: ALT #2:

dialogue: Nuh uh. This is one nightmare you can’t wake up from.
Wait, am I asleep right now?
So, technically this is not a nightmare.
So how can I not wake up? If I’m not actually asleep.

content.text: Scott shakes his head, baffled.

dialogue: Well, I’m really, really not up for this. Whatever it is.
Okay little chicken, then I’ll see you later. But you won’t see me. Because I’ll be deadly serious next time.

content.text: PAF - the Mystery Attacker vanishes. Scott looks to the sky.
Scott is in his usual payphone, dialing Stacey frantically.

dialogue: What did he do this time?
No, it’s Scott. It’s actually me.
What did you do this time?
I didn’t do anything. It’s everyone else that’s crazy. Look I need to talk to you, I’m having a meltdown or whatever. Are you still working?

content.text: Scott hangs up the phone and walks two steps into-
Scott approaches the counter. Stacey has her back turned.

dialogue: Think I’ll make it a decaf today.

content.text: Stacey turns around, revealing herself to be JULIE!

dialogue: AH! What did you do with my sister?

content.text: Stacey taps on the window outside, mouthing that she has to go. Scott turns back to Julie, not happy.

dialogue: What can I fucking get you?
Is there anywhere you don’t work?
They’re called ’jobs’, something a fuckball like you wouldn’t know anything about. And by the way, I can’t believe you fucking asked Ramona out after I specifically told you not to fucking do that!

content.text: (Note to concerned reader: Everytime Julie says "FUCK", a black bar comes out of her mouth and the sound is bleeped.)

dialogue: How do you do that with your mouth?
Neverfuckingmind how I do it! What do you have to say for yourself?
Uh. Can I get a caramel macchiato?
Maybe it’s high fucking time you took a look in a mirror before you wreak havoc on another girl.

content.text: Julie points at THE CLASH AT DEMONHEAD poster behind the counter with concert dates at the bottom.

dialogue: Fucking speaking of fucking which, I hear the girl that kicked your heart in the ass is walking the streets of Toronto again.
So I can pick up my coffee over here?

content.text: Scott retreats away from Julie and bumps right into... RAMONA. They share an awkward moment. She looks at the floor.

dialogue: Sorry that got a little crazy last night.
Yeah, I do that. Listen, I know it’s hard to be around me sometimes. I’ll understand if you don’t want to hang anymore.
No. No, I want to hang. The whole evil ex-boyfriend thing. No biggie.
I mean, I know it’s early days, but I don’t think anything can really get in the way of how I SHIT!

content.text: Scott hides behind Ramona as a lithe figure emerges from the steamed-milk mists of the coffee shop...the singer from THE CLASH AT DEMONHEAD has seemingly stepped out of the poster.
"ENVY ADAMS, 23, FUN FACT: KICKED SCOTT’S HEART IN THE ASS."
The icy, platinum blonde fashionista walks towards Scott.
Scott nods. LEONE STAREDOWN between Envy and Ramona.
Ramona goes to order coffee, leaving Envy to fix on Scott.
REVERSE: Scott is instantly wearing his DORKY HAT.

dialogue: You left me! For that cocky pretty boy!
Yeah. I know. You left me for a guy I’ve never even seen.
Maybe you’ll see him soon. We’re playing Lee’s Palace. You guys should like, so totally come.
That’s so not going to happen.
Great. You’re so on the list.

content.text: Envy disappears into the cappuccino mists. Ramona returns.
Scott and Ramona walk side by side, sipping their coffees.

dialogue: So...what did you guys talk about?
What happened with the two of you?
Do you mind if we don’t get into that right now?
She wanted to move to Montreal because she missed her best friend. This guy Todd.
And two weeks later, you heard they were sleeping together I guess?
I dated a Todd once. That didn’t end well either.
I can see how it sucks. Having the past come back to haunt you.
Is it wrong that I try not to think about it?
What do you want to think about?
How warm my place is right now.

content.text: Ramona stops and kisses him.
Scott lies between Wallace and Other Scott on the futon.

dialogue: And you didn’t bang her? Are you gay?
I couldn’t stop thinking about my stupid ex-girlfriend.

content.text: A bleary Jimmy sits up between them all.

dialogue: Is that the Uma Thurman movie?
Scott. Just because Envy’s back in town doesn’t make it not over.

content.text: Scott stands (no pants). Music swells.

dialogue: Right. I’m not gonna let her toy with me. From this moment on, I will think of Envy Adams no more!

content.text: A deadly serious Stephen Stills addresses Kim, Scott and Young Neil. Ramona lounges on the couch...

dialogue: Is the news that we suck? Because I really don’t think I can take it.
No. The Clash At Demonhead are doing a secret show tomorrow night. And Envy asked us to open for them.
A gig is a gig is a gig. Is a gig. Maybe you can put your history aside until we get through this thing. You know, for the band? For the band. For the band?
Can’t we do our own secret shows?
All our shows are secret shows.
We’re doing it. G-man might be there! We play the next round of the battle Saturday. We need to get some buzz going. We need groundswell. We need stalkers.

content.text: Stills paces past the window to reveal...KNIVES CHAU OUTSIDE. CRASH ZOOM on her tearful face, pressed against the window. TOTALLY CRUSHED to see Scott cuddling with Ramona.

dialogue: What would you do? If your ex was in a band and they wanted you to open for them?
If my ex was in the band?
It might be a little awkward. But maybe it’s the grown up thing to do.

content.text: KNIVES frantically rifles through racks of hair dye and rants furiously into her cellphone.

dialogue: He’s dating a fat-ass hipster chick! I hate his stupid guts! I’m gonna disembowel him!

content.text: Knives stands on her bed and continues ranting at Tamara.

dialogue: He only likes her cause she’s old! She’s probably like 25! She’s just some fat-ass white girl, you know?
I think you mentioned she was fa-

content.text: Tamara helps Knives color her hair under the bathtub spigot.

dialogue: She’s got a head start! I didn’t even know there WAS good music until like two months ago! Okay, this really burns.
I mean, he knew I was cool but he thought I was too young, so he tried to find someone cool but old.
She’s cool? I thought she was fat-
Well she THINKS she’s cool. This is all her fault.

content.text: Tamara turns the faucet on and rinses Knives hair.

dialogue: It MUST be her fault. Obviously it’s just a twist of fate or whatever, isn’t it? Star crossed lovers! Born too late!

content.text: Knives looks in the mirror: HER HAIR IS EXACTLY LIKE RAMONA.
Knives throws a long scarf on, looking sexy, eyes narrowing.

dialogue: Scott Pilgrim destroyed my heart. But I know how to get him back.

content.text: PUSH into Knives, as she plots. Tamara pops into frame.
We see a TEXT MESSAGE typing onscreen:
’YUNG NEIL ITZ KNIVES. OMFG UR SO HOTT’
A huge line of TOO COOL YOUTHS snakes outside a rock venue. A sign reads ’˜THE CLASH AT DEMONHEAD - Sold out’. We hear loud music blasting through the open doors.
The LOUD MUSIC stops abruptly. Sex Bob-Omb bow onstage.

dialogue: Thank you. We were Sex Bob-Omb.

content.text: Wallace and Other Scott clap and cheer, drunk. The other snobbish kids in the audience shrug and disperse.

dialogue: We got some merch out the back, so-

content.text: A disillusioned Sex Bob-Omb hang with Ramona at the bar.

dialogue: Level with me. Did we suck?
She has to go. She knows we suck.

content.text: Ramona excuses herself.
Ramona does her eyeliner. She looks in the mirror to see two images of herself staring back. Or is it...
"KNIVES CHAU, 17, SINGLE WHITE ASIAN" with identical hair, clothes and makeup, standing next to Ramona, looking hot.
Ramona exits, confused. Knives follows.
Ramona and Knives exit the bathroom together. Scott breaks into a cold sweat. Knives shoots Scott a sultry look.
Knives heads into Young Neil’s arms at the other end of the bar. Scott struggles with something resembling jealousy.

dialogue: Look who Knives is hanging with.
I bet Young Neil will date her even briefly-er.

content.text: A ’WHEEL OF FORTUNE’ spins INSIDE SCOTT’S HEAD, with selections such as ’It was nothing’ and ’She was nobody.’ The wheel sticks between ’I gotta pee.’ and ’Who, her?’

dialogue: I mean, I gotta pee. Pee time.

content.text: Scott washes his hands and looks up to see TWO SCOTTS staring back, one with fringed hair and a wicked glare! Scott whips around. He’s alone. SPOOKY MUSIC begins...
A freaked out Scott returns to the group. The lights dim and the stage fills with twisting blue tendrils of smoke.
THE CLASH AT DEMONHEAD materialize, ENVY in a long black coat. Knives screams her teen brains out.
The BASS PLAYER steps into the light, no longer shrouded in dry ice, he cuts a handsome, striking ROCK GOD figure.

dialogue: That guy on bass? That’s Todd.

content.text: Todd flips his fringe from his eyes. Stares at Scott.
"TODD INGRAM, 25, EVIL-EX #3, FUN FACT: 9TH DEGREE VEGAN"
Envy lets her coat slip off, revealing a stunning figure.
Sex Bob-Omb, Knives and Ramona hang near the BACKSTAGE doors.

dialogue: Oh my God. Just oh my God.
Man, you have to see them live. They’re so much better live. Oh.
I think I’m going to throw up.

content.text: Julie opens the backstage door and huffs.

dialogue: I can’t believe I’m even saying this, but Envy Adams would like all of you to come backstage.

content.text: The group shuffles backstage. Scott hangs his head like a condemned man.
Knives makes a face that looks like this: >:O !!!!
SEX BOB-OMB lounge on a couch on one side of the room. Envy, Todd and Julie lounge on a couch across from them.
Knives in shock as she thinks a thousand thoughts. Envy burns a hole through Scott. Everyone else feels... ’AWKWARD’.

dialogue: I think we should get out of here.
How was the tour? You played with The Pixies? You’re a superstar now!
It’s-yeah, it’s not something I can really put into words.

content.text: Todd and Julie glare at Knives.

dialogue: You guys are a cute couple, you know? You suit each other.
So what’s your ulterior motive Envy, in general?
She doesn’t need ulterior motives, Stephen. She’s got a write-up in Spin!
Just saying, cute couple. I like your outfit Ramona. Affordable?
I was going to say, Envy. Did you get those jeans in New York, they’re-
I’m talking to Ramona right now.
I was just there. We played the Chaos Theatre for Gideon. You know him, right?

content.text: Scott looks at Ramona. She is about to answer when...Knives stands up, POINTS at Envy and SCREAMS-

dialogue: I’VE KISSED THE LIPS THAT KISSED YOU!

content.text: Envy nods at Todd. He PUNCHES KNIVES SQUARE IN THE JAW! OMFG! Scott jumps to his feet, FACING OFF against Todd Ingram.
Young Neil rushes to Knives’ aid. Scott boils. Todd smirks.

dialogue: That’s right. I’m not afraid to hit a girl. I’m a rock star.
You punched the highlights out of her hair!

content.text: ANGLE on Knives. Her hair is black and plain as before.

dialogue: He punched the highlights. Out. Of. Her. Hair.
I don’t know the meaning of the word.

content.text: Young Neil escorts Knives out. Todd sits back down like nothing happened. Scott’s face is a bright shade of rage.

dialogue: So, are you guys doing anything fun while you’re in town?
That is IT, you cocky cock! YOU’LL PAY FOR YOUR CRIMES AGAINST HUMANITY!

content.text: Scott LEAPS across the table and SWINGS a punch at Todd. Todd THRUSTS a hand out and telekinetically FREEZES SCOTT IN THE AIR. Scott hovers, grasping his neck, choking. Todd’s hair magically forms into a FAUXHAWK.

Todd telekinetically HURLS Scott through the club’s wall! Ramona and Sex Bob-Omb peer through the newly made hole in the wall, to see Scott sprawled on some trash bags. He tries to keep cool, despite being in a lot of pain.

dialogue: I partake not in the meat nor breastmilk or ovum of any creature that has a face.
Short answer: Being vegan just makes you better than most people.

content.text: Todd lifts up Scott telekinetically and throws him miles into the air. Scott sails out of shot and into space.

dialogue: Hey man, question. I always wondered, how does not eating dairy products give you psychic powers?
You know how you only use ten percent of your brain? Well, it’s because the other 90% is filled up with curds and whey.
Did you learn that at Vegan Academy?
Go ahead and get snippy baby, if you knew the science, maybe I’d listen to a word you’re saying.

content.text: Scott returns to earth with a THUMP. He moans in pain. While the others bicker, Ramona helps Scott to his feet.

dialogue: If I peed my pants, would you pretend I just got wet from the rain?
Oh. How about you give me the Cliff Notes on how and why you ended up dating this a-hole?
Is that really important right now?
If there’s a key element in his backstory that can help me out in a critical moment of not dying? Yes.

content.text: A brief, scrappy ANIMATED FLASHBACK of Young Todd and Ramona.

dialogue: I was only dating Lucas until the minute Todd walked by. I guess that’s not very nice, but I used to be kind of...like that.

content.text: Young Ramona shoves Young Lucas down a hill and starts making out with Young Todd.

dialogue: We hated everyone. We wrecked stuff. Nobody cared.

content.text: Young Ramona and Young Todd wreck stuff. Nobody cares.

dialogue: He punched a hole in the moon for me. It was pretty crazy.

content.text: Young Todd punches a hole in the moon. It’s pretty crazy.

dialogue: A week and a half later, he told me his Dad was sending him to the Vegan Academy, so I dumped him. Does that help you at all?

content.text: The FLASHBACK ends. Scott can only fixate on one aspect.

dialogue: Have you dumped everyone you’ve ever been with? You’ve never been the dumpee?

content.text: Ramona shrugs.

dialogue: Look, I’ve dabbled with being a bitch. It’s part of the reason I moved here. I was really hoping to put it all behind me.

content.text: Todd appears behind Ramona - ready for another round.

dialogue: We have unfinished business, I and he!

content.text: Scott stands up - sort of ready for another round.

dialogue: Don’t you talk to me about grammar!
Tell it to the cleaning lady on Monday.
Because you’ll be dust by Monday.
Because I’ll be pulverizing you in two seconds. And the cleaning lady...cleans up...dust. She dusts.
Cos it’s Friday now and she has weekends off, so...Monday. Right?
Basically, you can’t win this fight and you’ll have to give up on this girl, ’˜cos Todd is going to kill you.

content.text: Scott CHARGES at Todd, who PSYCH-THROWS him back into the club. We hear a distant CRUMP. Stills calls through the hole.

dialogue: Uh, we’re going to Pizza Pizza for a slice, call us when you’re done.
Oh, he’ll be done real soon.

content.text: Sex Bob-Omb skulks away. Envy grins at Ramona, wicked.

dialogue: Sorry, baby. Crummy way to end things, I know.

content.text: Suddenly, the bass-line from FINAL FANTASY 2 rumbles through the walls. Todd calls to a roadie.

dialogue: Get me my bass. The good one.

content.text: SCOTT stands in an elephant’s graveyard of plastic cups and bottles, picking the hell out of his bass, amp pegged to 10. TODD INGRAM levitates, floating towards Scott with his bass.
Todd lands in front of Scott. BASS OFF! PICKS STRIKE STRING! Todd easily out-basses Scott, shredding him into oblivion. The enormous reverb LAUNCHES club debris towards Scott.

dialogue: The reverb is hurting my soul!!!

content.text: Scott slides across the floor and slams right into the wall. Todd LEVITATES, fauxhawk rising. He hovers next to him.

dialogue: That’s right, Pilgrim. I actually know how to play bass.

content.text: Todd DETUNES his bass and delivers a death note that BLOWS Scott right through the stage wall.
Scott crashes into a backstage food table. Todd floats toward him, savoring the kill. Envy appears beside him with a smirk.

dialogue: I can read your thoughts. Your bass hand is badly injured. You’re through.

content.text: Scott turns around on his knees, cringing, holding a cup of MILKY LOOKING COFFEE in either hand as a peace offering.

dialogue: What say we drink to my memory? Fair trade blend with soymilk?
Dude. I can see in your mind’s eye that you poured Half & Half into one of these coffees in an attempt to make me break vegan edge. I’ll take the one with soy. Thanks, tool.

content.text: Todd floats to the ground, takes one of the cups and drinks.

dialogue: Actually, I poured soy in this cup, but thought real hard about pouring it in that one. You know, in my mind’s eye or whatever.

content.text: TWO TRENDY POLICE TYPES BUST IN THROUGH THE WALL, making two more holes and pointing their fingers like deadly weapons.

dialogue: Todd Ingram, you’re under arrest for veganity violation code number 827, imbibement of Half & Half!
No vegan diet, no vegan powers.
But this is a first offense! Don’t I get three strikes?

content.text: Vegan Police Officer #2 flips open his CODE VIOLATION book.

dialogue: At 12:27 a.m. on February 1st, you knowingly ingested Gelato.

content.text: Milk and eggs, bitch.

dialogue: On April 4th, 7:30 p.m., you partook a plate of Chicken Parmesan.

content.text: Envy gasps, disgusted.
The Vegan Police BLAST Todd with arcs of power from their finger guns. Todd’s fauxhawk deflates into a bowl cut.
Scott rises into a stance to deliver his killer line...

dialogue: You once were a vegone, but now you will be gone!

content.text: Scott HEADBUTTS TODD, exploding him! POOM! Scott dusts himself off as COINS rain down. Envy stares, jaw ajar.

dialogue: Sorry? You just headbutted my boyfriend so hard he burst.
You kicked my heart in the ass. So I guess we’re even. Natalie.
No one calls me that anymore.
Maybe they should. Now let’s get out of here.

content.text: A battle worn Scott limps through the hole in the wall. Ramona follows, shooting Envy a look on the way out.

dialogue: Crummy way to end things, I know.

content.text: Envy blinks, in shock. Julie pops into shot.

dialogue: For the record, I am so pissed off for you right now.

content.text: Sex Bob-Omb, Wallace and Other Scott munch pizza slices. Ramona and Scott, on the fringes. It’s an odd mood.

dialogue: Envy Adams. I hate that bitch so much I kind of love her.
Yeah. That Todd guy was cool too. And hot. I liked him.

content.text: Scott sighs and holds a cold Coke Zero on his forehead.

dialogue: Do I look like I’m not okay?

content.text: Scott does not look okay. Stills coughs.

dialogue: We’re still going to the after show right?
I’m not sure it’s gonna be much of a party, I think a third of the band just went ’poom’.
Cool bands never go to their own after parties. It’s just the desperate people trying to rub elbows with label guys.

content.text: Neil is at the counter with a catatonic Knives. He shrugs.

dialogue: I kind of almost died back there, so...
I’m not saying I want to go.
I’ll do whatever you want to do.

content.text: Scott takes another bite. Other Scott whispers to Wallace.
The whole gang trudge to the after party. Scott limps a bit, lagging behind. Ramona falls back with him.

dialogue: We really don’t have to go to this thing. It’ll probably be a bad scene all around and we’ve already had a full night.
No, I’m fine, I’m fine. It’s just-
Well, not that fighting harder and harder battles for your love is getting old or anything...but have you ever dated someone who wasn’t a total ass?
So far you’re not a total ass.
If it makes you feel better, you’re the nicest guy I’ve dated.
It’s what I need right now.
Scott, I don’t have all the answers. I’d just like to live in the moment if I can.
Yeah, I’d just like to live.

content.text: Scott and Ramona enter a big, fartsy, artsy WAREHOUSE.

dialogue: Okay, I know Todd was bad news. But are you saying Envy wasn’t? We all have baggage.
My baggage doesn’t try and kill me every five minutes. What did you do to your ex-boyfriends to make them so insane?
No break up is painless. Someone always gets hurt. What about you and that girl Knives?
I believe...I broke up with her.
And was she cool with that?
Yeah. She’s very mature for her age. It was a very healthy break up. We’re all peaches and gravy.

content.text: We hear an offscreen distant ’˜nooooo’ from Knives.

dialogue: And what about you and Kim?

content.text: They pass Kim. She’s also staring at Scott. Not lovingly.

dialogue: Me and Kim? I can barely remember. Why, is it important?
Hey, you want to know everything about my past, dude.
It was just...yeah. I don’t know. It was high school. She had freckles. It was cool, I guess.
Yeah, it kind of ended. We changed.

content.text: Scott and Ramona have reached the bar at the party.

dialogue: OKAY! I had to fight a dude to get with her! I fought a crazy eighty foot tall purple suited dude! And I had to fight 96 guys to get to him, too! He was flying and shooting lightning bolts from his eyes! He was totally awesome and I kicked him so far he saw the curvature of the earth! Does that make you feel any better?
Well now you are being a total ass. Welcome to the club.

content.text: In the back glass of the bar, Scott sees his reflection: fringed hair, wicked glare. He catches himself.

dialogue: Sorry. I’m not usually like this.
Hey, don’t worry. I don’t know what I’m like anymore.
I guess this whole ex-boyfriends thing is really messing with my head.

content.text: PAF! A foot appears out of nowhere and KICKS Scott in the head, sending him flying across the dance floor. Scott looks up at his opponent, the MYSTERY ATTACKER!
Scott gets up. The three square off in a triangle.

dialogue: Oh boy, does she know me.

content.text: ’ROXY RICHTER, 23, 4TH EVIL EX : SAPPHIC AGGRESSIVE’

dialogue: I didn’t think it would count! It meant nothing.
I was just a little bi-curious.
Well honey, I’m a little bi-furious!

content.text: Roxy throws a SCORPION KICK at Scott’s face. Ramona CATCHES her foot mid-air. Roxy flips out of the hold.

dialogue: Do that again and I will end you.
Back off hasbian. If Gideon can’t have you, no one can. The League hath spoken.

content.text: The girls square off, clearing the busy dance floor.

dialogue: Then Gideon best get his pretentious ass up here, ’˜cos I’m about to kick yours out of the Great White North.

content.text: RAMONA pulls a LARGE HAMMER from her purse.
An embarrassed Scott watches with the rest of the crowd.

dialogue: Oh yeah. KICK HER IN THE BALLS, RAMONA!

content.text: With blinding speed, Roxy slips her belt off and WHIPS A RAZOR SHARP FLYING GUILLOTINE BELT BUCKLE at Ramona! Ramona CARTWHEELS as the buckle sails between her legs and SMASHES into a DISCO BALL. Mirrored shards fly everywhere.
PAF! Roxy vanishes as Ramona SWINGS the hammer at her. It smashes a speaker. Sound on one side of the room cuts out.
Ramona turns around just in time to see Roxy’s deadly belt SAILING towards her. She BLOCKS with the hammer. The belt wraps around it. Roxy HURLS the hammer out the window.

dialogue: I’m sending you back to Gideon in a thousand pieces, you slag.

content.text: Ramona springs off of various pieces of furniture, LEAPING towards Roxy and PUNCHING HER IN THE FACE. Roxy REELS and SLAMS into the wall, leaving a dent in it.

dialogue: I’d rather be dead than go back. He’s a creep, you’re a bitch and you all deserve each other.
Give it a rest, Ramona. This is a League game.

content.text: Roxy points an accusing finger at the mortified Scott.

dialogue: Meaning your precious Scott must defeat me with his own fists. Or possibly feet.
I’m not sure I can hit a girl. They’re soft.

content.text: Ramona positions Scott into a fighting stance as Roxy CHARGES with deadly intent. Ramona puppeteers Scott into a furious volley of PUNCHES on Roxy. She staggers, winces.

dialogue: Fight your own battles, lazy ass!

content.text: PAF! Roxy disappears then REAPPEARS between Scott and Ramona, kicking them apart with the splits. Roxy then KICKS Scott into the ceiling. He lands HARD on the floor.

dialogue: Every Pilgrim reaches the end of his journey. Some sooner than others.

content.text: Roxy lifts her leg over her head, preparing to drop her boot of DEATH on Scott’s head. She grins at Ramona.

dialogue: Your B.F’s about to get F’d in the B!
Her weak point’s the back of her knees!
Whenever we were making out, I-

content.text: As Roxy’s leg descends, Scott reaches up with one finger and lightly TICKLES the back of Roxy’s knee.
GRAPHIC: ’TICKLE TICKLE!’
Roxy falls, still in the splits, throbbing with orgasmic meltdown. Scott watches as Roxy giggles between spasms.

dialogue: You’ll...never...be able to do this to herrrrrrrrrrr!

content.text: Roxy screams in ecstasy before EXPLODING into COINS. A spent Scott is left standing in the middle of the room.
The party starts up again, a wave of gossip spreading around the room. People text furiously and point fingers at Scott.
Scott flushes red and retreats back to the bar. Ramona follows tentatively. The gossip echoes around them.

dialogue: Only on special occasions. Why? Did you want one?

content.text: Scott swigs down his drink. Ramona tries to lighten things.

dialogue: I guess we really don’t know that much about each other do we?

content.text: Scott seems immediately drunk.

dialogue: Maybe you could just give me a list of all your exes so at least I know who’s going to beat my ass into the ground next.
Oh, like a handy little laminate or something? Let me see if I can find one.
Maybe we could exchange our information. Scott has already downed his second drink.
Just out of sheer curiosity and concern for my mortal well-being, is there anyone at this party you haven’t slept with?

content.text: EVERY GUY AND GIRL AT THE PARTY
HEY!
Ramona stops. Looks hurt. She touches her hair.

dialogue: I really think we should split.
As in ’˜get out of here’? Or as in ’˜split split’?
I’d hope you could figure that out. Or did you miss the part where I saved your ass?
How could I not? I feel like we just washed our sexy laundry in public.
Well I’m sorry I cared. I don’t enjoy all this Scott. In fact I’m sick of it. I thought you might be more understanding.
You’re just another evil ex- boyfriend waiting to happen.

content.text: Ramona walks off and loudly announces:

dialogue: And yes, there is someone at this party I haven’t slept with. You.

content.text: Ramona leaves. Another crescendo of gossip echoes around the room. Scott’s friends gather round in a pity party.
But then - Ramona returns, handing Scott a LAMINATED LIST.
Ramona exits proper. Scott looks at the list. It reads-
’PATEL, LEE, INGRAM, RICHTER, KATAYANAGI TWINS, GIDEON...’

dialogue: Who the hell are the Katayanagi Twins?

content.text: Stills flips to hand drawn sketches of THE KATAYANAGIS, identical Asian twins dressed like pretentious New Wave fops.

dialogue: They’re the next band in the battle and they are badass.

content.text: We reveal a grim, terse Scott playing a doomy bassline. The rehearsal room feels empty without Knives or Ramona.

dialogue: You know what? I don’t know and I don’t want to know.
Good. You know how I feel about girls cockblocking the rock.
Good. I play better in a bad mood.
If it’s gonna be an issue though, Young Neil can fill in for you.
It’s not an issue. You know bands, I know battles. We got it covered.
Well, we’d understand if you didn’t want to take part.
Not only do I want to take part. I want to take them apart.

content.text: Sex Bob-Omb and Young Neil load their gear at the venue.
Flyers cover the outside walls of another rock venue:
’T.I.B.B! SEX BOB-OMB!! THE KATAYANAGI TWINS!!! AMP VERSUS AMP!!!! TWO BANDS ENTER!!!!!! ONE BAND LEAVES!!!!!!!!!!!’

dialogue: That flyer needs more exclamation marks.
Oh, we are going to get killed.
Come on. You’re onstage in five.
Aren’t the Katamaris or whatever on first?
I think you’re both on first?
Wait...amp versus amp? We’re going on stage at the same time?

content.text: ’ACTUALLY, NO’
Two stages sit on either side of the auditorium. On one: a MONOLITHIC WALL OF ELK AMPLIFIERS. On the other, SEX BOB-OMB, with their dinky LAME BRAND amps behind them.

dialogue: Your bad is saying my bad.

content.text: Sex Bob-Omb stare up at the Katayanagi amps, sweating behind their instruments. Stills looks into the audience positioned between the bands: a legion of identical INDIE TEENS.
